The place has been serving burgers and beers since the mid-60's for a reason. It's a Phoenix institution.   Beers run from the like of PBR, to Coors Banquet, to Moose Drool - with a bunch of other offerings to please your palate and your wallet. Mugs, glasses, and pitchers are frosty.  Burgers are super-tasty! (I usually go with mushroom and swiss).  This is an old-skool bar that has a flat-top grill and a deep fryer. It also has the most comfy arm rests you've ever laid your elbows on, lining the bar; so belly up and order a wineburger and a brew.  Note: They close around 10pm most nights - so don't expect to hit this place up for a nightcap.
The food was alright .... the service was alright .... Just an "eh" kind of restaurant.

Stiff drinks and delicious burgers? What more can you ask for!? The Original Wineburger is simple, topped off with your choice of American, Cheddar, Pepperjack or Bleu cheese along with the traditional toppings of onion, tomato, pickles, and lettuce. That's it! What makes this burger so good? The patty is super juicy, the bun is as soft as an angel's bottom, and the cheese is melty. Melty cheese is a must in my book, because I love cheese! It's everything I need in a burger.  As for the other menu items, we've tried the breaded mushrooms and stuffed jalepenos - both also glorious fried goodness. The jalepenos were truly stuffed and when you bite into them the cream cheese oozes out in  a wonderful waterfall of cream cheese.  The only part I think may deter people is the ambiance. The ambiance is very hole in the wall. This place has been around since 1965, so what can I say? If it's ain't broke, don't fix it. Come here for the burgers!

Nice little neighborhood spot. I used to frequent the other Wineburger, ( in the early 70's) on 16th and Bethany.  This took me back in time.  Gotta love those fries and burgers.  The chili is perfect for dunking all of the items into.  Order a bowl for the whole table to use as dip!

Is this the best burger I've had, no but it's very good.  It's kind of a sad statement of the local eateries where just being a good burger gets you listed as a go to place. It's one very small step above a dive bar but worth the trip for a burger and beer.

It's a tasty burger!  I grew up in Phoenix and always remember it being there.  Had a bar so the family didn't go there much but we would drive by and smell it it!  Wow.  Grew up and "rediscovered" Wineburger when we moved into the neighborhood and went local.   We now go there often and LOVE the new sign!

I guess I'll have to give this place another shot, because I can't say it knocked my socks off. It didn't really impress me as much as I anticipated but I may have been distracted with figuring out how to assemble a new wire shelf from Target, or those thoughts of putting order into the spare room. Whatever the situation, I have to say my burger was okay, at best. Perhaps because I tend to eat my meat more on the raw side?  Wineburger is a bar, to me, above being a restaurant. And that's okay! There is a nice--albeit limited--beer on tap selection. The grill is right behind the bar so you can watch your burger being cooked, which is nice. But my burger was cooked until it was crispy. Huh?  Something came up partway through my lunch and I took half my burger home. It didn't heat up well.   So, I'll have to go back and be certain to have them cook my burger a bit less, and order some of these tasty-sounding sides. It's very likely I will be changing my rating based on that experience.

Our bill for 4 was $61 and no alcohol was had as the ordered beers never arrived to the table. Soda was $3+ . There were 2 other tables occupied and 3 men at the bar where the only server spent her time. She graced our table 4 times.  Burgers were ok but nothing of note. Sadly we won't be going back. Unfortunate as we live within walking distance.

A for effort but the flavor is off. The fresh fries where different. The burger did not taste the same. A bit dry and way less flavor. Sad to see they moved. Oh well it's not like I need burgers. Now more if a hole in the wall sports bar. TVs open concept. No games to play.

Someone called this a "hole in the wall". I would call it a bar. Still, the burger and fries were good. Next time I'm in Phoenix, I will have a beer with my meal.  So how do you decide if something is a restaurant or a bar? This place had a bar, for sure, and beers on tap and probably the mixed drinks, but it also had a menu. Not a full, hundreds of items menu. Mostly in the burgers and fries area (from what I recall). Still, the burger was pretty good.

I liked this place because of its simplicity and of course because the food was pretty good.  It was a seat yourself kind of deal and we found ourselves an empty booth and only waited a couple minutes before the lone waitress came over and handed us menus and took our drink order.  After some deliberating I went with the Original Wineburger with American Cheese and Bacon.  We also ordered the "Pounder of Fries".  It took a little longer than I thought it should have for just burgers and fries, but I was in a good mood so I didn't let it bother me.  Our fries came out in a huge mound in a basket and they were soooooo good!  They were incredibly crispy on the outside but nice and soft and fluffy on the inside.  They were really good.  The burgers came out on really small plates which I found humorous but I expected it after reading the other reviews.  My burger was perfectly cooked and the bacon was thick and delicious.  None of this was greasy.  I really liked this place and I love that it cost under 20 bucks for our meal.  Great place that feels comfortable to eat in.  I do have to mention though, if you have seen "True Blood" this place will totally remind you of Merlotte's.
I had the Original  Wineburger, medium rare with cheddar and a side of beer battered fries.  The burger was cooked perfectly and both burger and fries were delicious.
